Package project.restaurant.controllers

Class ChangeMenuController

java.lang.Object
project.restaurant.controllers.ChangeMenuController
@Controller public class ChangeMenuController extends Object
ChangeMenuController manages front-end to back-end connection for menu changing on the waiters side.
Author:
James, Faraz, Pete

  • Constructor Details

    • ChangeMenuController

      public ChangeMenuController()

  • Method Details

    • getMenuChange

      @GetMapping("/menuChange") public String getMenuChange()
      This method forwards a user to the menuChange webpage.
      Returns:
      "menuChange" the html link for displaying options to the waiter to change the menu

    • addItem

      @GetMapping("/addItem") public String addItem()
      This method forwards a user to the addItem webpage.
      Returns:
      "addItem" The html link for adding an item to the menu

    • addItems

      @PostMapping("/addItems") public String addItems(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @RequestParam("itemName") String itemName, @RequestParam("description") String description, @RequestParam("price") Float price, @RequestParam("file") org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file, @RequestParam("stockAmount") Integer stockAmount, @RequestParam("category") String category, @RequestParam("ingredients") String ingredients, @RequestParam("calories") Integer calories) throws IOException
      This method will add an item to the menu_items table in the database by taking user inputs.
      Parameters:
      session - A method to identify a user, a kitchenstaff or a waiter across more than one page
      itemName - The name of the dish entered by the user
      description - The description of the dish entered by the user
      price - The price of the dish entered by the user
      file - The image of the dish entered by the user
      stockAmount - The amount of the dish currently stored
      category - The category of the dish's type entered by the user
      ingredients - The ingredients of the dish entered by the user
      calories - The calories of the dish entered by the user
      Returns:
      "menuChanges" The webpage for menuChange
      Throws:
      IOException - If a user inputs the wrong type for a parameter, throw an IOException

    • getRemoveItems

      @GetMapping("/removeMenuChange") public String getRemoveItems()
      This method will remove an item from the menu.
      Returns:
      "removeMenuChange" is the link to the page that allows a waiter to remove a dish

    • getSearchItems

      @GetMapping("/searchItems") public String getSearchItems(@Param("keyword") String keyword, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This method allows a waiter to search for a specific menu item given a keyword.
      Parameters:
      keyword - given to menuItemsRepository as the item name and description
      model - A method to identify a menu item on one webpage
      Returns:
      "removeMenuChange" is the link to the page that allows a waiter to remove a dish

    • getViewMenu

      @PostMapping("/viewMenu") public String getViewMenu(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This method allows a waiter to view the current menu from the users perspective.
      Parameters:
      model - A method to identify menu items and their category on one webpage
      Returns:
      "viewMenu" The link to the page that allows a waiter to view the current menu

    • getEditRemoveMenu

      @PostMapping("/editRemoveMenu") public String getEditRemoveMenu(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This method allows a waiter to view the current menu from the users perspective and delete an item.
      Parameters:
      model - A method to identify menu items and their category on one webpage
      Returns:
      "editRemoveMenu" The link to the page that allows a waiter to delete or view an item

    • getRemoveItem

      @PostMapping("/removeItem") public String getRemoveItem(@RequestParam("aMenuItem") Integer itemid)
      This method will actually remove an item from the menu using the menu item's ID.
      Parameters:
      itemid - The ID of the item that is going to be removed
      Returns:
      "menuChange" The link to the default menu change page

    • getEditItem

      @PostMapping("/editItem") public String getEditItem(@RequestParam("aMenuItem") Integer itemid, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This method will allow a waiter to edit a menu items attributes.
      Parameters:
      itemid - The ID of the menu item being edited
      model - A method to identify menu items and their ID on one webpage
      Returns:
      "editSpecificItem" The link to the webpage that allows an item to be changed

    • getUpdateItem

      @PostMapping("/updateItems") public String getUpdateItem(@RequestParam("aMenuItem") Integer itemid, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @RequestParam("itemName") String itemName, @RequestParam("description") String description, @RequestParam("price") Float price, @RequestParam("file") org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file, @RequestParam("stockAmount") Integer stockAmount, @RequestParam("category") String category, @RequestParam("ingredients") String ingredients, @RequestParam("calories") Integer calories) throws IOException
      This method actually updates an item when it is being edited.
      Parameters:
      itemid - The ID of the menu item being updated
      session - A method to identify a user, a kitchenstaff or a waiter across more than one page
      itemName - The name of the dish entered by the waiter
      description - The description of the dish entered by the waiter
      price - The price of the dish entered by the waiter
      file - The image of the dish entered by the waiter
      stockAmount - The amount of the dish currently stored
      category - The category of the dish's type entered by the waiter
      ingredients - The ingredients of the dish entered by the waiter
      calories - The calories of the dish entered by the waiter
      Returns:
      "menuChanges" The default page where a waiter can change the menu
      Throws:
      IOException - If a user inputs the wrong type for a parameter, throw an IOException
